text: The All New Adventures of Laurel & Hardy in 'For Love or Mummy' is a 1999 comedy film directed by John R. Cherry III and Larry Harmon based on the film shorts of Laurel & Hardy. It stars Bronson Pinchot and Gailard Sartain re- creating the eponymous characters played by Stan Laurel and Oliver Hardy. This was the first of only two non-Ernest P. Worrell films that Cherry, primarily an advertising executive, has ever directed, the other being Pirates of the Plain. Harmon earned writing and directing credits through the ownership of the Laurel and Hardy trademarks, which he had purchased in the 1960s. Another Harmon-owned character, Bozo the Clown, is mentioned in the film. ==Premise== Laurel and Hardy are in Florida where they meet archeologist Henry Covington, whose daughter they try to protect from the wrath of a mummy. ==Cast== * Bronson Pinchot: Stan * Gailard Sartain: Ollie * F. Murray Abraham: Professor Henry Covington * Philip Godawa: Farouk Bin Abdullah * Susan Danford: Leslie Covington * Jeffrey Pillars: Barney the biker * Rick Rogers: Lt. Kowalski * Farouk Valley-Omar: Habib * Larry Harmon: Owner of Bozoworld * Christine Weir: Ms. Burkum * Zane Meas: High priest * Gordon van Rooyen: Party man * Matthew Haldenby: Mummy * Jonathan Pienaar: Young professor Covington * Shannon Bowie: Young Leslie * Lara Bye: Laura Covington * Josh Cherry: Officer Levin * Jeff Shapiro: Desk cop * Peter Spiropoulos: Maitre d' * Anton Stoltz: Chef Marino * Timo Chaplin: Kid on skateboard * Ryan Stuart: Pistol cop. ==References== * * * ==External links== * * Category:1999 films Category:English-language films Category:American films Category:1990s buddy comedy films Category:American buddy comedy films Category:American screwball comedy films Category:Cultural depictions of Laurel & Hardy Category:Films set in Egypt Category:Mummy films Category:Films directed by John R. Cherry III Category:1990s screwball comedy films Category:1999 comedy films
title: The All New Adventures of Laurel & Hardy in For Love or Mummy
